Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2023/0220 b) Date of Occurrence: 07/06/2023
c) Installation Details: Stormbird Attack - AC-2613-603 at
Zone-4 Facility
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 10/06/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Exhaust System d) Main Assembly: Station-2 Starboard
e) Nomenclature: Exhaust System Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Standard
g) Part No.: PR-3867-J5 h) Sl No.: SN-7386-269
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 30/01/2021 l) Date of Removal: 09/06/2023
Pg No: 131 Ln No: 26 Pg No: 2 Ln No: 19
m) Manufacturing Agency: Advanced Flight Technologies n) Date, Month & Year September 2016
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2849 Hrs / 1847 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Major
b) Defect Observed: Starter generator malfunction. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Foreign object damage to critical surface
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Exhaust System component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Adjust calibration settings to manufacturer specifications
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Enhance operator training on proper usage procedures
d) Attributable Code: N1 - Defect confirmed but reason not established
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 28/06/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit.
Date: 30/06/2023 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User perspective considered. Recommend update to operating procedures based on lessons learned.
Date: 01/07/2023 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval.
Date: 05/07/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
From regulatory standpoint, investigation meets required standards. Approve proposed corrective actions.
Date: 05/07/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
